repnme.cdata!:
Kyrgyz Republic - Financial Sector
            Adjustment Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated satisfactory,
            having contributed to positive developments in the financial
            sector, through the creation of the legal, and regulatory
            framework, conducive to a strong, and stable banking system.
            However, the timing for the reform process - the supervising
            agency was being strengthened at the breakout of the
            financial crisis - hindered the capacity, and experience in
            banking supervision, thus its sustainability remain
            uncertain. Lessons reinforce the notion that government
            commitment to, and ownership of a reform program, as in this
            case, is conducive to successful results. But as experience
            suggests, the implementation of a comprehensive reform
            approach, requires a consistent, and correct sequence of
            enterprise, and financial sector reform, to avoid, as
            mentioned above, an erroneous timing which may hamper
            financial sustainability. Nonetheless, the macroeconomic
            stability of the Kyrgyz Republic, paved the way to reduced
            volatility of capital flows, and enhanced the potential for
            safe financial management, which was instrumental in
            attracting investments, and facilitated credit risk
            management. To finalize, strong financial systems require
            enforcement powers, thus effective banking regulation, and
            preventive early-warning systems, and instruments for
            depositors protection, should be in place for effective
            on-site examination, and off-site surveillance.

5081085.majtheme: Economic management,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Kyrgyz Republic - Financial Sector
            Adjustment Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objectives of the
            Financial Sector Adjustment Credit Project are to: 1) allow
            increased production and capacity utilization through the
            provision of foreign exchange resources to finance imports
            of inputs, raw materials, spare parts and services; 2)
            create a competitive, sound and efficient banking system; 3)
            improve public confidence in financial institutions; 4)
            foster a health adjustment and renewed growth in the
            financial sector, which will contribute to the
            government's stabilization objectives; 5) encourage the
            development of sound contractual savings organizations; and
            6) develop technical capacity in banking and financial
            management and reinforce the implementation of the
            country's reform program as a whole.  The components of
            the projects are the following: 1) creation of a policy and
            regulatory environment conducive to the sound growth of a
            competitive and efficient private banking system; 2)
            liquidation of the two dominant and insolvent state-owned
            banks: Agroprombank and Elbank; 3) downsizing and financial
            restructuring through private re-capitalization of two large
            and insolvent former state banks: Promstroi and AKB
            Kyrgyzstan Banks; 4) creation of a temporary Debt Resolution
            Agency to help collect, restructure, sell or write-off the
            old non-performing loans, and thus accelerate enterprise
            restructuring or liquidation in the process; and 5) creation
            of a regulatory and supervisory framework, and supporting
            policies and infrastructure, for the development and growth
            of emerging non-bank financial institutions.

docna.cdata!:
Kyrgyz Republic - Financial Sector
            Adjustment Credit Project
